description: Architectural princicipal ITQ for the conservation of the Maison Joseph-Gavey in the Parc national...
full_summary:
**Title:** Stage 1 - Joseph Gavey House Preservation, Forillon National Park
**Reference Number:** cb-171-60567006
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-24-0007/A
**Publication Date:** April 25, 2024
**Tender Closing Date:** May 23, 2024  / 14:00:00 (Eastern Daylight Time)

**Project Description:**
The Parks Canada Agency invites qualified bidders to submit a two-stage selection process for the preservation of a recognized heritage house, the Joseph Gavey residence, located in Forillon National Park, Quebec. The house will be converted into tourist accommodation.

**Bid Submission Requirements:**
Bidders must submit their application in response to this ITQ (Invitation to Qualify) document. All submissions must be received via email. Bidders are advised that emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments.

**Submission Guidelines:**

* Bidders are required to submit their application electronically via the specified email address: soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* Bidders are advised that emails must not exceed 15 megabytes in size.
* For submissions larger than 15 megabytes, bidders are requested to send their application in multiple emails properly labeled with the solicitation number, project name, and indicate how many emails are included (e.g., 1 of 2).
* Bidders are reminded that their application must be sent as email attachments, not through links.

**Stage 1: Invitation to Qualify**
The evaluation of qualifications will be based on the information provided in the application. Bidders who have not demonstrated compliance with the requirements may be invited to resubmit and be considered in Stage 1/B.

**Stage 2: Invitation to Tender**
Successful candidates from Stage 1 will be invited to submit further documentation and a financial offer.

**Important Instructions:**
A two-stage selection process is essential to ensure the most suitable contractor is selected. Bidders are expected to follow the guidelines above. Failure to comply may result in rejection.

**Timeline:**

* Contract Start Date: April 26, 2024
* Contract End Date: November 1, 2026
* Examination period: comments and questions will be processed until 5 business days prior to the Tender Closing Date.

**Contact Information:**
For any questions or clarification regarding this solicitation, please direct them to:
Cloë Pelland Tess
